answers.answer: i have suffered from low-blood sugar but i never took that drug :)
Antipsychotics can cause this.  I've never taken Zyprexa but I know it can cause this.  I'm pretty sure your blood sugar will return to normal after you stop taking it.
The thing is that I stopped taking this medication a year ago, and my blood sugar didn´t return to normal.

Did you develop diabetes during the course of taking the medication?  I experienced symptoms of high blood sugar while I took Geodon until my body adjusted to it, although I never had my blood levels checked so I'm not sure if it WAS because of high blood sugar.
I had diabetes symptoms while taking the medication, only that I didn´t know they were diabetes symptoms.

question: Did any of you develop hyperglicemia or diabetes after taking zyprexa? Did your sugar numbers went back to normal when quitting the medication? Are the sugar problems caused by zyprexa reversible?
title: Zyprexa and diabetes?
